title: Slow initial sync and checkpoint save errors
body:
My node with 55 peers on a 1 gigabit connection has been syncing for 39 hours and it says it has another 54 hours left.

Is this normal or can it be sped up somehow? Thanks

![DeepinScreenshot_select-area_20220726015639](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/168240/180966705-07289800-efcb-437a-bc50-283f130c82b9.png)
Can you tell us more about your system hardware? Is this a solid state drive?

Additional info

![DeepinScreenshot_select-area_20220726020657](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/168240/180968955-c1f83982-e081-431e-8757-1b9119d963a3.png)

Yes it's an SSD

Docker config

```sh
#!/bin/env bash

ETH1_PROVIDER="https://mainnet.infura.io/v3/<redacted>"

docker run \
        --name beacon \
        --detach \
        -it \
        --restart=unless-stopped \
        --log-driver local \
        --log-opt max-size=2gb \
        -p 4000:4000 \
        -p 13000:13000 \
        -p 12000:12000/udp \
        -v $HOME/.eth2_beacon_chain:/data \
        gcr.io/prysmaticlabs/prysm/beacon-chain:stable \
        --datadir=/data \
        --rpc-host=0.0.0.0 \
        --monitoring-host=0.0.0.0 \
        --accept-terms-of-use \
        --http-web3provider="$ETH1_PROVIDER"
```

@miguelmota You can try running with `--enable-vectorized-htr`, it should speed it up non-trivially , alternatively you can look at using checkpoint sync:
https://docs.prylabs.network/docs/prysm-usage/checkpoint-sync

@nisdas thanks for the suggestions. Trying `--enable-vectorized-htr` didn't seem to make much of a difference unfortunately. Is there a way to list peer host addresses in order to use `--checkpoint-sync-url`?

@miguelmota This requires the use of the beacon API, so `peer_ip:api_port` would work if you have another peer running that has its port accessible to the new node that is checkpoint syncing. Is there a usecase that you are targetting that does not work ?
@nisdas I don't have another node running so can't checkpoint so was wondering if I can use a random peer on the network to use for checkpoint

Ah, a random peer from the network will not work here as it is a trusted state and you need access to that node's api. There are 3rd party services through which you can access this service. Ex: Infura, other node provider services, etc.
@miguelmota happy to chat more about this in our Discord https://discord.gg/prysmaticlabs. Closing this issue for now

@miguelmota You don't actually need a separate node for this, you can simply take regular checkpoints from your currently active beacon node and in the future if you need to start a fresh sync again you can just use those previously fetched checkpoints to run your node. The checkpoint state and block would be about 40mb.

@nisdas ah I see thanks. I'm trying to run the checkpoint save command as mentioned in the docs but running into some install errors

```sh
[validator@intelnuc tmp]$ go version
go version go1.16.5 linux/amd64
[validator@intelnuc tmp]$ go run github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/cmd/prysmctl checkpoint save --beacon-node-host=http://localhost:3500
no required module provides package github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/cmd/prysmctl: go.mod file not found in current directory or any parent directory; see 'go help modules'
```


@miguelmota Your go version might be too old here, could you try updating to 1.17 or 1.18 ?

@nisdas I updated to latest go but getting module errors when trying the `go run` command from docs

```sh
[validator@intelnuc tmp]$ go version
go version go1.19 linux/amd64

[validator@intelnuc tmp]$ go run github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/cmd/prysmctl checkpoint save --beacon-node-host=http://localhost:3500

	go get github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/cmd/prysmctl

[validator@intelnuc tmp]$ go get -u github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/cmd/prysmctl

[validator@intelnuc tmp]$ go get -u github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/cmd/prysmctl@develop

	github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/beacon-chain/rpc/apimiddleware imports
	github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/beacon-chain/rpc/eth/events imports
	github.com/grpc-ecosystem/grpc-gateway/v2/proto/gateway: cannot find module providing package github.com/grpc-ecosystem/grpc-gateway/v2/proto/gateway
```

any additional help and suggestions is greatly appreciated!

Hey @miguelmota , you are probably running into this issue:
https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/issues/10006 

We will be fixing this in our v3 release very soon (1 week eta), but as a work around you can use a commit:
```
go get github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm@4e225fc667d8df6f8254803d5ae3122be08fd003
```
Then run this, it should work.

@nisdas go get with that commit succeeds but I'm unsure on how to run the prysmctl cli

```sh
[validator@intelnuc tmp]$ go get github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm@4e225fc667d8df6f8254803d5ae3122be08fd003

[validator@intelnuc tmp]$ go run github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/cmd/prysmctl@4e225fc667d8df6f8254803d5ae3122be08fd003

	The go.mod file for the module providing named packages contains one or
	more replace directives. It must not contain directives that would cause
	it to be interpreted differently than if it were the main module.
```

@nisdas nice prysmctl is working with go 1.18 :)

the checkpoint command is returning a 404 error and I'm not sure how to proceed

```sh
[validator@intelnuc prysmctl]$ go version
go version go1.18.5 linux/amd64

[validator@intelnuc prysmctl]$ go run github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/cmd/prysmctl checkpoint save --beacon-node-host=http://localhost:3500

FATA[0000] error requesting state by id = finalized: code=404, url=http://localhost:3500/eth/v2/debug/beacon/states/finalized, body=response body:
{"message":"Not Found","code":404}: recv 404 NotFound response from API: did not receive 2xx response from API
exit status 1
```

beacon node docker command used

```sh
docker run \
	--name beacon \
	-d \
	-it \
	-p 4000:4000 \
	-p 13000:13000 \
	-p 12000:12000/udp \
	-p 3500:3500 \
	-v $HOME/.eth2_beacon_chain_data:/data \
	gcr.io/prysmaticlabs/prysm/beacon-chain:stable \
	--datadir=/data \
	--rpc-host=0.0.0.0 \
	--grpc-gateway-host=0.0.0.0 \
	--monitoring-host=0.0.0.0 \
	--accept-terms-of-use \
	--enable-vectorized-htr \
	--http-web3provider="$ETH1_PROVIDER"
```
That doesnt make sense, it should be fine, @kasey any ideas ? @miguelmota Does this happen each time you run it

@nisdas yes every time I try the checkpoint save. I'm using latest `stable` image

Understood, will let kasey give his view on this as he is most familiar with this feature.

> beacon node docker command used
> 
> ```shell
> docker run \
> 	--name beacon \
> 	-d \
> 	-it \
> 	-p 4000:4000 \
> 	-p 13000:13000 \
> 	-p 12000:12000/udp \
> 	-p 3500:3500 \
> 	-v $HOME/.eth2_beacon_chain_data:/data \
> 	gcr.io/prysmaticlabs/prysm/beacon-chain:stable \
> 	--datadir=/data \
> 	--rpc-host=0.0.0.0 \
> 	--grpc-gateway-host=0.0.0.0 \
> 	--monitoring-host=0.0.0.0 \
> 	--accept-terms-of-use \
> 	--enable-vectorized-htr \
> 	--http-web3provider="$ETH1_PROVIDER"
> ```

Hello, looking at your beacon node command I see that you are not specifying the flag to enable debug endpoints, including state retrieval. Debug endpoints are not enabled by default because they are expensive requests to serve (therefore potential DoS vectors). As per the the checkpoint sync doc[1] you need to add these flags to your beacon node docker command: `--enable-debug-rpc-endpoints` and `--grpc-max-msg-size=65568081`.

[1] https://docs.prylabs.network/docs/prysm-usage/checkpoint-sync
@kasey ah I should have read the docs more carefully. That worked, thank you!
